Description: Large fragment of undyed linen and with most of one side covered with rows of weft loops (c.4.5cm long); in the centre a square of tapestry (c.27x27cm) in undyed linen and purple wool; central medallion poorly preserved but appears to have been two leaping lions on a background of branches; border of 16 small medallions containing a stylised jewel; outer border of dotted finials; at one end of the fragment part of one of the original ends of the cloth with a warp fringe (max. 5cm long), held by a line of hitches in double thread; at c.3cm in from the fringe is a band of bare warp threads; loops do not begin until 12cm in from fringe; some self-stripes in this smooth area; other edges torn or ragged; warp-faced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/c.18), weft-undyed linen (S/c.9); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/c.18), weft-undyed linen (S) and purple wool (S/c.40-50); sewing where there are slits at the side of the tapestry, closed with overcasting in linen (S) thread; knotted sehna loops float over c.6 threads and just passing back between them, forming a loop, and returning by passing over the same 6 threads before passing between the next c.6, on reverse rows of loops and disguised by double self-bands
Curator's comments: Kept with a separate fringes wrapped in paper
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
